intro: Antiaropsis decipiens var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved antiaropsis, is a species native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
